comments.body: summary should print without having to do a `head` here?
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -25,20 +25,21 @@ library(SparkR)
 sparkR.session(appName = "SparkR-ML-bisectingKmeans-example")
 
 # $example on$
-irisDF <- createDataFrame(iris)
+t <- as.data.frame(Titanic)
+training <- createDataFrame(t)
 
 # Fit bisecting k-means model with four centers
-model <- spark.bisectingKmeans(df, Sepal_Length ~ Sepal_Width, k = 4)
+model <- spark.bisectingKmeans(training, Class ~ Survived, k = 4)
 
 # get fitted result from a bisecting k-means model
 fitted.model <- fitted(model, "centers")
 
 # Model summary
-summary(fitted.model)
+head(summary(fitted.model))

comments.body: In this case, `summary` returns a DataFrame. It won't print out the contents of the DataFrame.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -25,20 +25,21 @@ library(SparkR)
 sparkR.session(appName = "SparkR-ML-bisectingKmeans-example")
 
 # $example on$
-irisDF <- createDataFrame(iris)
+t <- as.data.frame(Titanic)
+training <- createDataFrame(t)
 
 # Fit bisecting k-means model with four centers
-model <- spark.bisectingKmeans(df, Sepal_Length ~ Sepal_Width, k = 4)
+model <- spark.bisectingKmeans(training, Class ~ Survived, k = 4)
 
 # get fitted result from a bisecting k-means model
 fitted.model <- fitted(model, "centers")
 
 # Model summary
-summary(fitted.model)
+head(summary(fitted.model))

comments.body: ok :) so we could add a print.summary.bisectingKMeansModel like other models :)
